page.title: 01Carron Valley Fetteresso
page.content: This block forms the middle section of the valley of the Carron Water and comprises mostly agricultural land interspersed with small blocks of coniferous plantations. To the N of the Carron (running W to E) the land rises steeply, forming the flanks of afforested hills out with the block. To the S the land rises more gently to culminate in Carmont Hill (236m) in the SW corner, which has a heathland summit. A network of minor roads runs through the area and also the main Aberdeen-London railway, following the Carron Valley. Some strips of deciduous woodland are next to the river eg. at Auquhiries Farm. Small farms and crofts are scattered throughout the area and there are no major industrial, residential or other developments. The carron is a trout river although an occasional spillage
